record.title: AUTHORIZING USE OF THE ROTUNDA
record.narrative:
AUTHORIZING USE OF THE ROTUNDA -- (Senate - March 11, 2008)

[Page: S1839]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of H. Con. Res. 313, received from the House and at the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will report the concurrent resolution by title.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:

A concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 313) authorizing the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to honor the 5 years of service and sacrifice of our troops and their families in the war in Iraq and to remember those who are serving our Nation in Afghanistan and throughout the world.
record.narrative: There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the concurrent resolution.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the concurrent resolution be agreed to and the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 313) was agreed to.
